TestCase.TestCaseObjective: BSO validation. Test whether the Producer/Provider is able to create the correct MIP data for all the operational elements (defined by IDT Schema Documentation > Unit.xsd > Unit) and the Consumers are able to correctly understand (and display) it. This case is focused on the Unit's GeometricDefinition element when it is undefined.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: The Producer creates message elements for Unit with at least all its mandatory Elements. The Consumers receive the data and process them. GeometricDefinition Element is set to nil.
TestCase.TestCaseEnvironment: Internet or Co-located. Exchange Pattern: R/R, P/S.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: The Producer/Provider has created the 'Ground Picture > Forces' topic. The Consumers have subscribed to this topic.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: This test is considered a success if the unit is created and all attributes are processed and interpreted correctly on all Nations' C2IS.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction:
The Producer creates the Unit with name XXX_UL_017 and fills ALL its mandatory elements with values, taking special care to set an undefined GeometricDefinition.
Notices: XXX in name of the object is meant (in principle) to be replaced by the 3 letter code of the country name. Example for the name of the unit: ITA_UL_017
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Consumers receive and process (and display) the Unit created and all elements that the Producer created.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: The Producer creates an update for the object by changing its GeometricDefinition element with nil value. The OrganisationOperationalStatusCode is also changed, keeping the values of the rest of elements.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Consumers receive and process (and display) the created Unit with undefined location and all elements that the Producer created.
